question.body: What is the difference between a keloid scar and an atrophic scar?

multiple_choice.choice: A keloid scar is raised and an atrophic scar is sunken.
A keloid scar is sunken and an atrophic scar is raised.
A keloid scar is sunken and an atrophic scar is hypertrophic.
There is no difference; they are the same type of scar.

response.feedback: Correct. A keloid is a raised scar, also called hypertrophic.
Incorrect. A keloid is a raised scar, also called hypertrophic. An atrophic scar looks sunken.
Incorrect. Hypertrophic (keloid) scars are raised, atrophic scars are sunken.
